title: COIN EI / EC Services in the EEU from requirements to first adoption

Of our extension to enlarge Europe.
Uh.

Exchange.

For us, and it was a challenge for the whole credibility of the coin project.

Difficult to implement, difficult to adopt, and we appointed some coin Angels in order to make this capital since disappear, or at least to mitigate.
The effect of these capital scenes.

Regarding interoperability, we had, for instance Professor G Domain, who gave his experience in the domain of enterprise interoperability for SMS and tried to demonstrate that in reality interoperability solutions are also useful and easy, easily accessible by SMS.
But in cool 5 or Vice City we we had a very great opportunity, be 'cause there was a call which was 9.5.
I think the Objective 95 which says OK, we have the possibility to enlarge your running project to enlarge it Europe countries.

This is not only a formidable way to increase our dissemination and exploitation potential to other countries and to the overall Eastern Europe countries, but it is also a very good opportunity to measure and test.
Whether the coin solutions are really useful and really easy to use also for SM is also for countries which do not have an IT infrastructure so developed like the Western Europe countries.
And this was a challenge for us.
We put together 6 new test cases and then with the help of three coin partners, TST.

Very easy.

Addressing one of the presentations afterwards, then we have a favorite in Bulgaria.
And in fact, that the real challenge was that we addressed multimedia multimedia sector and the challenge was also to integrate the their existing collaboration platform with the coin instruments.
So in this case we are not providing the coin collaboration platform to them, but we are going to integrate our services into their own platform, existing platform.

Which will in some way try to demonstrate that our solutions are really open and interoperable, so we speak of interoperability, but if our solutions are not interoperable interoperable, then we failed our mission.

Loader loader is a very good test case in Turkey and it is about logistics and in particular logistics of dangerous substances like paints and how to manage the relations between the manufacturer, the final destination and the logistic logistic chain.

And Lastly, we have a Cypress and inside pro, so we had a very important test case for the economy of this island which is marine shipping and marine shipping is favored by Cypress for fiscal and legislation issues.
There are a lot of vessels which are in the in the flag of Cyprus and Cyprus needs really to modernize.
It's a money shipping industry and interoperability and collaboration services.
One of the means to make this industry more modern and more up-to-date.
How this six test cases fit into our butterfly model or double cloud model?

First of all, they are located here, so the center of gravity of these six new partners is in the collaboration platform that is in the supply chain for the railways industry or in the business ecosystem in agriculture or for collaborative networking, civil construction and so.
